item.title: Closing a frame created by outStream.createFrame
item.dc:creator: @AfterLifeLochie AfterLifeLochie
item.description:
@AfterLifeLochie wrote:

Hi all,

I’ve been using showInterface() and hideInterface for a while and I’ve now started using frames, but, despite all efforts, I can’t work out a method to close() or destroy() the created frame.

Here’s the code I’m using to create the frame:

public void frame35(int i1, int i2, int i3, int i4) // earthquake
	{
		outStream.createFrame(35);
		outStream.writeByte(i1);
		outStream.writeByte(i2);
		outStream.writeByte(i3);
		outStream.writeByte(i4);
		updateRequired = true;
		appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
	}

And, so, I have no real idea how to close it. I’ve tried outStream.closeFrame(), outStream.destroyFrame(). And, on top of that, you can’t access any other controls or reset the frame, which has me confused.

Any ideas?
Thanks.

Read full topic
item.source: Closing a frame created by outStream.createFrame
